comment: Attendance isn't mandatory, but I wanted to go.  She's got a great/dry sense of humor that I loved.   I never really knew sociology could be that interesting.  Would highly recommend Dr Friedman and would take another of her classes.  Make sure and do your readings and take notes, and you'll do fine.  The tests aren't a "given"!!!

A very engaging teacher, you can tell she loves what she teaches. She's always willing to meet with students after class if they have questions. All you have to do is show up and learn, then take the quizzes and tests, it helps to read what she assigns if you want to stay caught up though I din't most of the time. It helps that she's very pretty!

Prof. Friedman is truly passionate about what she teaches. She also makes subject matter clear and enjoyable. Her powerpoint lectures give a lot of the info you need, and the text supplements that. The exams aren't too hard as long as you study. DON'T FORGET ONLINE QUIZZES.

Love the teacher. However, if you like your grades back in a timely fashion she is not the teacher for you. She has a bunch of easy assignments which helps your grade and And dhe has the tendency too change the syllabus. Partcipation is big and take good notes the book does not help.

She's a really great teacher and is good at getting the class involved. She has very interesting questions and open view points. It's a very analytical class but as long as you attend, do weekly online quizzes and read you'll have no problem. Plus she's a gorgeous woman, which makes it  encouraging to attend and easy to pay attention to her :)

The class is interesting enough by itself but Dr. Friedman makes it that much better! She loves what she does and it shows. You MUST read to do well on the tests. She does take attendance but it doesn't count against you to miss class. The more you attend class and read the better you will do. She knows her stuff!
I loved this class! As long as you attend the class and do the readings you will fly through this class.  She makes the material very interesting to learn. Can't wait to take her again in the Fall!!

I loved this class! As long as you attend the class and do the readings you will fly through this class.  She makes the material very interesting to learn. Can't wait to take her again in the Fall!!  IF you do not like to go to class and do a lot of reading, then do not take her class, otherwise you will pass with no worries.

Dr. Friedman is a great professor. The class is overall easy if you do the work. there is a lot of reading and the test are all essay and you have weekly theory journals and an articles. if your looking for an easy A then don't take her, but if you actually care and want to learn something she is great.

Her class was quite difficult. Her tests are all essay and there is A LOT of reading. If you do not go to class, you will fail. She knows her stuff and her lectures are interesting, but test time is very stressful. Also takes her time on returning grades back to you.

This class was not easy; take this prof if you're actually interested in learning. It's time consuming but it's all useful info. I found the tests intimidating but fair: a balance of knowledge and understanding. To do well, read what's assigned, come to all classes, engage with the material. Feminists note: prof understands prejudice & privilege.

I did the readings. I took notes in class. Class is not mandatory, but I still showed up every day. Worked my butt off. I enjoyed her lectures and she seems sympathetic, but her tests literally made me feel like I was taking a standardized test: more than one answer sounds right. I took this class as a senior so I know how to study. Still got a B

The class material is very straightforward. Complete the readings and show up to class because some exam questions are based on class discussions. In my opinion, the class was interesting and an easy A. Most of the people who claim she is a hard professor are freshman so I wouldn't take there comments so serious.
DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. The only grades you have are 4 tests. Thats IT!! And the tests ARE NOT easy. She assigns extra credit that is extremely hard and rediculous. Find another professor. Seriously
The professor is really accommodating.  Her examples are current and up to date.  Her exams are hard, but she will work with you if you have any questions.

There is a TON of reading. It was really hard to keep up with it. There is no homework, just 4 tests that are each worth 25% of your grade. But the tests are not easy. It covers all the readings and discussions from class, so even though attendance isn't mandatory if you miss class you won't pass the tests. I wouldn't take her again.
Nice Prof..tests are too difficult. Would not take her again. Interesting class but she makes it harder than it needs to be. I did study and read the articles...

There is A LOT of reading. She only gives 4 tests, no papers or homework. But if you don't do all the readings, and pay attention in class, you won't do well. There is no attendance policy, but she does use discussions material from class time on the test, so if you don't show up make sure you know someone in class that takes really good notes!

Prof. Friedman is a great lecturer and tries to include everyone in discussion. She is neutral but engaging. In order to do well you must read all assigned readings and be well prepared but I don't think that's too much to ask. I appreciate her style of lecture and she puts her self out there as far as help is concerned. HIGHLY recommend :)

Mrs. Friedman is very helpful in class and allows lots of time for questions and makes herself available after class if you need help. Our textbook was all readings every class she lectured from a powerpoint and you need to be in class to take the notes! I would recommend putting a study group together so you can split up the readings! Great class!

I highly recommend this class. If you do the readings and pay attention in class, you'll definitely make an A. The material is really interesting and easy to understand. It's probably my favorite class this semester!

She is very nice and helpful if you need more explanation. Some find her class hard, but that's basically because they don't apply the material to the test or even read. So make sure you read, and her notes are outlines. Make sure to add to them. Keep up with readings and focus, you'll do fine.

If you read ALL the readings assigned and answer all the questions on the study guide you WILL pass with an A. You dont even need to show up for class. Just keep up with the readings and know everything on the study guide. If you choose to go to class, just take good notes. She's a really nice person and the class isn't hard at all.

First of all the professor is fair and not as difficult as many people are saying. You will need to read and you will need to prepare. If you do that you WILL get an A. I think most of the negative reviews are caused by lack of intelligence and less to do with how good of a professor she is.  On a lighter note. SHE IS SMOKING HOT!

if you pay attention, take notes, read the readings and study you will be fine for this class! her testing is a lot of applying the knowledge which can be difficult but hello this is college. if you are a good student and will do what is required of you i highly recommend this class.

I had to drop this broad exam after the first exam. I got an F, I studied, and read the readings. Her test remind me of the SAT. All the answers look right but you must select the best answer. In class she goes over the material in very general terms,which does not correlate with the exam.Nor does she go over the readings. No bueno!!!!

Gives very hard tests or I just don't have the reading comprehension to understand her questions. Vague in her explanations/expectations. She  is nice though and her classes are pretty interesting but I probably won't take anymore. To much work no reason

If you don't have to take her, try and take someone else. She's nice, but she makes a simple class really difficult. Her tests are hard, she does not post notes online, she was even absent and gave a long assignment instead of just canceling class. She let us bring food but who cares if you fail the class...
she's very nice, but the tests are hard. If you read all the readings, you'll be fine.
Her exams are extremely difficult. Classes are boring, be prepared for a rough class :(
